thread.title: Two men shot, critically wounded in Gary
thread.title_full: Two men shot, critically wounded in Gary | Chicago Sun-Times

title: Two men shot, critically wounded in Gary
text:
Two Northwest Indiana men were both critically wounded in a shooting early Saturday in Gary.
Officers responding to a call of shots fire about 2:15 a.m. in the 4100 block of West 19th Avenue found the two men, ages 35 and 42, sitting in a white Chevrolet Trailblazer, both with multiple gunshot wounds, according to a statement from Gary police.
They were both taken in critical condition to Methodist Hospital Northlake, police said.
Anyone with information on the shooting is asked to contact Detective Sgt. Edward Jenkins or Detective Sgt. Joe Hardiman at (219) 755-3852.
